intro: Asplenium viviparoides, commonly known as the viviparous spleenwort, is a fern belonging to the family Aspleniaceae. It is a small, epiphytic or lithophytic fern that typically grows on trees or rocks in moist, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and the presence of specialized structures called sporangia, which produce spores. One of its notable features is its ability to reproduce vegetatively through the production of plantlets on the underside of its leaves. This unique reproductive method contributes to its ecological significance in forest ecosystems.
